page.title: 04WOODLAND PARK NEAR ALVA
page.content: The Woodland Park is part of the{land {scape}between Alva and Tillicoultry.The land was planted by Sir John Erskine in the 18th century. It was originally made for a{garden round Alva House.The stable block designed by Robert Adam can still be seen and it and the 18th century Ice House are the only parts of Alva House which remain today. It is a good place to visit because there are 3 different walks.There is a playing area with an assault course, tree house and sand pit.The Woodland {Park}is a good place for Birdwatchers. It is now cared for by Clackmannan District Council and is a{conservation area.
